SEARCH
Package org.projectsw.Model

Class Game

java.lang.Object
org.projectsw.Util.Observable<ResponseMessage>
org.projectsw.Model.Game
public class Game extends Observable<ResponseMessage>
The class contains information about the game state, including the board, players (with info on the currently playing one and the first one), chat, and common goals.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Game()
    Creates a new instance of a SILLY Game, with a new chat, an empty player list, a full-unused board and an empty commonGals list.

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game()
      Creates a new instance of a SILLY Game, with a new chat, an empty player list, a full-unused board and an empty commonGals list. First and current player are not set yet. This is a silly constructor, so the number of players is set to 0;

  • Method Details

    • initializeGame

      public void initializeGame(int number)
      Creates a new instance of a Game in LOBBY state, creating it with a new chat, an empty player list, a board set for the right number of players, the correct number of players and an empty commonGals list. Also sets the given first player to current and first player.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the position of the player is wrong or if the number of players is not between 2 and 4

      Parameters:

      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the passed player has a position that not corresponds to the next free one

    • randomCommonGoals

      public ArrayList<CommonGoal> randomCommonGoals() throws NoSuchMethodException, InvocationTargetException, InstantiationException, IllegalAccessException
      Returns the ArrayList of commonGoals containing two random commonGoals chosen from the children of CommonGoal.
      Returns:
      the ArrayList of commonGoals containing two random commonGoals chosen from the children of CommonGoal
      Throws:
      NoSuchMethodException - when there's no method defined as such
      InvocationTargetException - when a called method generates an exception
      InstantiationException - when the class cannot be instantiated
      IllegalAccessException - when the caller cannot access the method or parameter

      Return an arrayList of commonGoals based on the indexes passed
      Parameters:
